website_summaries.verdict: A super camera microphone that offers the best sound recording quality for interior and outside use.
pros: Small and lightweight for mobile use
Powered from the camera itself, eliminating the need for a battery
Integrated shock mount does a good job of reducing vibrations
cons: Included windscreen can often come loose or fall off of the microphone

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a brand new Rode Video Mic Go, and it makes the audio SLIGHTLY louder, but the background noise is louder, too. It sounds horrible! And, that is standing less than 2 feet from the mic straight on. It would be easier to just talk louder and use the built in microphone on my Canon Rebel T6i. WHY??? Because the mic is a COUNTERFEIT! When I went to register the mic at rode.com, it showed that my serial number was already registered to another owner. I will be contacting Rode! The seller was Beschen and fulfilled by Amazon. You are welcome for the donation.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimes

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my iPhone
customer_reviews.text: This mic is way better then my iPhone mic. This is directional so now I hear less of myself when filming my kids. The mic is very light weight. Since I'm using this with my iPhone, I had to by a better quality lighting to 3.5mm adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bui

customer_reviews.title: omnidirectional, not shotgun at all
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mic as a backup to using lavelier mics. However, everytime I need to rely on this mic as the backup it has failed me. In a room full of people each sharing a testimony I pointed the camera with the mic and the image stabilizer on the lens was immensely picked up, as well as the noised people around and behind me made. It picked up more from behind me than right in front of me to be honest. Had it for a year now, and I'm gonna store it as a backup of a backup, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This mic records unavoidable signal interference no fix.
customer_reviews.text: USE HEADPHONES IF YOU CAN'T HEAR IT IN THE VIDEO If you use this in a house with Wifi or within 10 feet of a wireless device, this microphone will record a choppy, static sound that you won't be able to edit out in post. This microphone picks up my Smartphone wifi and my camera's wifi. I have the mic seated on top of a Canon M50 using the flash shoe. I have tried shielding the stock cable, and I have tried other cables with better shielding & shapes (straight vs coiled) nothing works. This sound defect is unacceptable. Do not buy this mic if you care about how your audio sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound, Great Price. (10/14/16 Update, I do like this Mic, but when I shot my first Film/Video Shoot, the Audio had a Hiss. I came to find out this is common with DSLR Cameras. Spoke to RODE, they recommended what I had heard on YouTube Etc., that you either purchase a FiiO Audeo Headphone Amplifier (Turn down DSLR sound level and amplify it with the FiiO), or purchase the Video Mic Pro, lower the DSLR Sound Level and use the Mic +20DB Boost) Anyway, hope this helps the DSLR users out there)
customer_reviews.author: James Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Came Broken
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see this Mic at a great price , upon opening the package I noticed the box looked like it was found outside of a dumpster(first warning), I proceeded to open the package and saw that the microphone and the plastic it was connected to were broken. It seemed to me that no one decided to check on the actual product before shipping it out to someone else. Beware of used items; amazon has a return policy which is good for 30 days for any reason which is awesome, but on the downside your looking at 10-15 days total from the time you returned it to get that full refund. back.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoTrend

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop making high pitch noice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic to improve my sound quality, but as soon as I added it on it wont stop making this constant high pitch noise! No matter what I've tried, it wont go away! I looked up this problem to see if I could fix it and found a bunch of other unhappy customers as well who has this exact problem and cant make it go away! Really disappointing and I feel really unhappy with this product as it's useless and not worth all the money! :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about an hour 4x into using it.
customer_reviews.text: This microphone did not work straight out of the box... I was able to make it work on occasion and thought it was fixed. Now that the return window has passed, it does not work again. Tinny, muffled, crackling or darting noise happens every single time. For something that is $100, it should work better than just once. I will never buy this brand again, and I will make sure any other blogger I know does not use this. Total waste of my hard earned money and time trying to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki W

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my amateur equipment bag
customer_reviews.text: Of note: I am not a professional videographer, so their opinions may differ from mine. I bought this mainly to do some amateur videos for a friend's wedding and I was happy with the result. It really boosted the sound quality on my Canon T7i video, and most of the ambient noise was cut out. I really liked that it was affordable for something I would only use for fun and only on occasion. The low profile, light weight and, and size also makes it easy to travel with. The "installation" on the camera was incredibly easy to figure out for someone using external mic for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: mcam2

customer_reviews.title: The interference issues make it unusable.
customer_reviews.text: The mic would be good if they had made it properly to keep interference out. It’s useless for anyone who is using a camera that has WiFi, the clicking caused by the WiFi connection to the camera makes it unusable. I was using a GoPro Hero 7 and the only way to use this mic without clicking noises was to turn WiFi off on the camera. You can YouTube it for yourself, people are out there wrapping this thing in foil to stop the noise, but that did not work for me and not would I find that acceptable. I returned it and bought the next model up which does not have interference issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but totally Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm very impressed with the rode mic. Though it is a little pricey, it's very lightweight, has a Sleek design, and has it just an incredible sound quality! I use it to shoot video, and some minor vlogging with my Canon t6i, and I have found the clarity of the audio on this microphone to actually outperformed the blue ice microphone that I had at my desk. There's no insulation, or drivers. You just plug it into your camera and mount it with a simple screw plate for tension, and go record!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dees

customer_reviews.title: Absolute waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My microphone had that "clicking" noise that other people seem to be complaining about as well. I tried unplugging it, plugging it back in, different cables, etc. Nothing got rid of it. No matter how far I got from my WiFi router I still heard it. This is a shame, the audio quality behind the clicking noise is fantastic, but you can't get rid of that clicking noise. It's pretty loud, and constant (2-3 times per second). Im getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Donavan

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for quality
customer_reviews.text: This mic pics up sound very well. Have only used indoors and didn't bother attempting outdoors until I ordered a dead cat for this exact reason. Seems to pick up very well from in front of or behind camera. There is a low humming sound coming through upon replay. Reason to believe that it is interference, which I did not expect and may not be ideal long term. Overall, honestly its priced at more than its worth, but a good beginner mic.
customer_reviews.author: Haunted Heather

customer_reviews.title: Loud buzzing - tin foil fixed it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought three of these, all of them had a loud buzzing noise. I tried every combination of cable, and camera available and the only thing that stopped the buzzing was wrapping tinfoil around the back of the mic and the cable. According to youtube the WiFi interferes with it and causes the buzzing feedback in your audio. With so many good mics out there this is a ridiculous oversight from Rode. Look elsewhere for your mics. (and yes I bought mine sold and shipped by amazon so it should be genuine Rode)
customer_reviews.author: Momma Bear

customer_reviews.title: Close, but definitely not it
customer_reviews.text: So there's a constant ticking noise in the background. After extensive research I found out that this is a very common problem. Rode says it's from near by Bluetooth enabled devices. You're supposed to make sure all bluetooth devices are off when you're recording but I experimented and recorded without any Bluetooth devices around and still got the ticking noise in the background . As beautiful as this microphone looks, unfortunately it's a waste of money. I hate to say it because it looks so good on my camera. I will be returning this😞😞😞😞
customer_reviews.author: Deshon Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my Sonny FDR-X3000 action cam. First ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Sonny FDR-X3000 action cam. First time I used it, it was recording alright but there was this clicking sound. Checking youtube, all one has to do is turn off the wifi on the cam when recording. Problem solved. For the Sony action cam, I put it on airplane mode while am shooting. Turns off bluetooth and wifi at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Hardright

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but it has a constant ticking sound ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but it has a constant ticking sound in videos. It could just be because of my computer when I was next to it, but I will see it later on. Edit: May 16th, 2018 - I've had this Mic for a good while now. I still hear constant ticks. Ive changed the male male input with a more expensive one and still same ticking. Changed from 5 to 3 stars. With time, videos came about and a lot of others are having this same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Missing the Windshield
customer_reviews.text: Item came without windshield. Now have to order one. Annoying. That was supposed to be inside: High quality directional microphone No battery required Integrated Rycote Lyre shock mounting Rode's lightest mic at only 73g Rugged reinforced ABS construction Windshield included 3.5mm mini-jack output Integrated cold-shoe mount with 3/8” thread
customer_reviews.author: I.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting Mic
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome microphone! The sound quality is 100x better than it was before on my DSLR. The great thing about this as well is that it can be attached to a boom pole and a secondary recorder. This is a great low budget microphone for any starting filmmaker or videographer. The only problem that I have is along with taking video I also do photography at the same time. The microphone sticks over the back of the camera and gets in the way of using the viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mulkern

customer_reviews.title: Hissing and buzzing noise
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on my DSlR but their is a constant buzz or hiss in the background of all my videos when using this mic. It is hard to remove it even with good editing software. My internal mic on my DSLR canon camera is better than this mic which doesn’t make sense. I would have returned it but it says I’m passed the return date. I’m going to try practicing with the distance of the sound and using this mic and see if that is the issue but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PWag

customer_reviews.title: Got the clicking noise..
customer_reviews.text: I found the same issue mentioned in the reviews, the mic will generate clicking noise during recording, this happen randomly, though I found it more likely to happen if I carry the camera while recording. Very disappointed. I bought the Rode Videomic ($150) model, which require a battery, and its much better than this one..
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and purchase a different microphone!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mic to mount onto my Panasonic GH4 (which I only use inside a studio and film videos from for my YouTube channel). This was to be my back up mic but the sound quality is so HORRIBLE that I can't use it at all. There is a terrible hissing sound and the amount of work that must be done in post production to try and better the sound quality makes the $$ saved by purchasing this inexpensive microphone not worth it. Overall, I would NOT recommend this mic to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Marly Bird

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been a musician since age 5 and pride myself in having a "good ear". I tested this mic on my Nikon D5600 and honestly couldn't tell any difference in sound with it plugged in or not. I was expected a noticeable difference but there wasn't any.
customer_reviews.author: Howard H.

customer_reviews.title: More of the same... Hissing/crackling
customer_reviews.text: When the microphone is on the camera, it gets a LOT of electrical interference from the camera and results in annoying hissing and crackling sounds. When the mic is not mounted directly above the camera, i.e. a tripod off to the side rather than being in the shoe mount, this noise was non-existent. It's a nice remedy but that kind of eliminates the purpose of it being an "on-camera" microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Best small shotgun mic! Still working years later!
customer_reviews.text: If taken care of your mic will last a LONG time! I have had this one now for a couple of years and it is still working! It picks up awesome sound! My suggestion though would be to watch a few tutorials on how to set the mic and the levels on the camera, once you got that down it picks up sound nice and crisp!
customer_reviews.author: Takedownman

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: While not super powerful, it works great as a fill light or to replace a bounce board on faces in bright light to remove shadows. The thing that makes it great is its size. Easy to pack, holds a charge, runs a long time depending on the level selected. Nicely packaged and documented. I use the Bluetooth interface a lot.
customer_reviews.author: McGregg

customer_reviews.title: Right price, right mic
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed that it didn't work with my Pixel 2. Fantastic news - it does work with the new Pixel 3! Pointing the mic straight up and removing the wind cover, we were able to get rich sound with 10 people around an 12 ft long table. Great price point for a solid mic. Make sure your device is compatible first though.
customer_reviews.author: PBS

customer_reviews.title: Major electronic interference......
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mic to go with my Panasonic G85, the interference caused by either a cellphone, drone, or any other electronic device that comes within a foot of this mic makes the audio useless due to mild to extreme buzzing and clicking noises. The micro (while cheaper) is apparently a little better, but again definitely not this mic if you want to have any audio. Save your time and money and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris WTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Literally didn’t read the reviews on this mic and just got it based on the overall rating and let me tell you, the feedback noises and everything poor that everyone else said is TRUE. This is truly disappointing and I’ll be sure to do my reviews thoroughly before my next mic purchase. I literally just got this in the mail and I am about to return it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Peters

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy connection
customer_reviews.text: The Rode VMGO video Mic GO is an effective mic because it is light-weight and easy to attach. However, there is a clicking noise that happens if the camera's wi-fi and Bluetooth aren't shut off. The black mic holster has a long plastic attachment that is connected to the red mount, it is a tad flimsy. My mic broke off when I had a tri-pod malfunction and my camera tipped over.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this microphone! It makes my videos sound so clear and crisp, plus if there is any noise around it it seems it out and focuses what's in front/ main point of sound! I have not formally reviewed this on my youtube channel YET but if you would like to hear how it sounds in video check my youtube channel out at bubbylioness I have a canon rebel t3i in cas you were wondering what type of camera I attached it to. It is very steardy once on. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: BubblylionessTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: VMGO - Occasional Interference - good quality though
customer_reviews.text: I took a film production class and I don't like borrowing school equipment(makes me nervous and it was just and introductory class) So I just used my own DSLR (Nikon D3300) it does seem to have an issue where it can get an electronic click, I've only ever had it do it once when I was having to film by myself and using a remote clicker to take a photo so i can check my head room, etc. and it took a few seconds and some distance from the remote to stop it receiving interference. Definitely a disaster if you only have the chance to do one take.
customer_reviews.author: Elish

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement from stock mics
customer_reviews.text: If you want even further sound quality, I would recommend the batter powered 'active' version. However, this mic is still great. A lot of high quality YouTubers use this mic and also recommend it. I can definitely assure you, it's a major improvement from the stock mics on any camera.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this item as an accessory for our camera to help make video compilations for weddings. We have also decided that this is a quality item for recording music and also different YouTube videos for his business that he can update his customers on what's going on. This is obviously a very well renowned company and for obvious reasons. Look no further if you are looking for a quality microphone!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah and CoryTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Honestly want to give it a 5star but ive used it a couple times and it didn’t work that well. Idk why but if i was recording something meaningful I would have really been aggravated with it, luckily i was just messing around. Its really cheap feeling but it does a wonderful job when its working and its actually pretty durable considering how light it actually is
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: TRASH
customer_reviews.text: If you ordered this... return it... If you are outside you're return window, thow it in the trash. I love Rode mics, but this Rode VideoMic GO Lightweight is TRASH. I watched tutorials, I played with all the settings on my t3i, I tried post-edit with Final Cut Pro - nothing works. This is a piece of garbage. It isn't event the background noise. It is the feedback. The on-camera mic is as good. Not even kidding.
customer_reviews.author: Easton D.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of background hmmmmmmmmmm........ You can edit that hummmmm..... out in post production. You get what you pay for. It is well made and works. The benefit is that it is a carefree mic. Plug it in and go. (The Rode Video Mic Pro with battery operated pre gain is much quiter and well worth the money for better audio).
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to this review before deciding to spend your money on a microphone for your camera
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this microphone a lot. It was delivered and I took it out of the box and was excited to use it. After 3 tests I wanted to go ahead and return it. There is no metal of any kind to block interferences with this microphone. For example wifi signals, phone signals, bluetooth signals. You will hear constant clicking noises. There is no permanent fix to this. Tech support has no actual solutions to this. So do not buy this mic.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: NEEDS TO BE CLOSE TO SUBJECT FOR RESULTS.
customer_reviews.text: This mic when compared to the Canon 60D internal mic is not better. In fact its about the same. This was tested at about a 6 foot distance from the camera. the Canon 60D internal mic was a tad brighter but the Rode Videomic Go actually didnt improve any quality. I also tested on a boom stand above 1.5 ft away at 45 degrees from the subjects mouth and only then did the quality increase by a small amount. You need to be close to it in order to hear a difference. If you want high quality you'll need to invest more money!
customer_reviews.author: Justin D.

customer_reviews.title: I love the simplicity of this
customer_reviews.text: Keep it away from wifi signals, and it's a superb mic!! If you have it near your phone as a hot spot, or near a router, or anything wireless internet, you will get a popping, hissing sound that will RUIN your video!! Rode, put some shielding on this thing!! I love the simplicity of this, and it truly DOES sound amazing. Rode just needs to ratchet up the shielding on this mic, and it's good to go anywhere!!
customer_reviews.author: inrharmony

customer_reviews.title: It Is A Rode Mic and I am Happy... I Guess
customer_reviews.text: The package looked open and the mic had some scoff marks on the back. It was definitely a used item. I just wished they would've sold it as a used item. I did pay less because the box had some minor denting but it was opened and resealed with scotch tape. I got what I wanted and it sounds great. I do suggest you turn off the wifi on your DSLR because if you don't it will pickup horrible interference. It will ruin your recording for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba_T_Rex

customer_reviews.title: Not the best with phones
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with this mic at first because it added pops and snaps to the audio when I used it with my phone. The problem went away, however, when I put the phone in airplane mode. Still, I prefer the smaller Rode mic. It comes with the wind buffer.
customer_reviews.author: bwricks

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I am a wedding videographer and I have used this now on two of my weddings and it seems to work very well the only thing that I wish was that it was easier to travel with. I tend to just throw everything in my backpack and I always worry that this will break but besides that the sounds quality is good, nothing like a lapel mic but it still will work if well if you are in a quite space and the subject is directly in front of you.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Has had literally the worst hiss & crackling background noise ever during all of my audio tests using this synched up with a Zoom H1n.... Every other mic, INCLUDING the stock H1n mic work 100x better than this. The audio quality is not even usable - that's how bad it is. Enough said. Frustrated. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: A Great Rode Vlogging Mic
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a great investment. I love that it does not require a battery to operate, just the power from my Cameras' Mic Input. Crystal clear sound recording for my tech Reviewing Studio for youtube videos. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fingerz

customer_reviews.title: Worse Mic I ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I finally start using this mic after having it sit in my closet for almost a year and let me tell you this is the worse mic ever the quality is ridiculous. I purchased it when it was at $100 each and what a big mistake. My sound quality sounds better when I use my camcorder mic. I suggest you don't purchase this MIC.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin D

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It didn't really suppress the sounds at the sides and it didn't isolate the main voices at 20 feet. It also caused a feint squealing through the video cam and auxiliary monitor. Wanted to send back but waited 3 days too long. Now I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Strong

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For the price I expected better noise cancellation/reduction. My videos sound pretty bad with all the noise. I upgraded my $30 mic to this one because it did not require batteries but I’m so disappointed in the quality of this mic.
customer_reviews.author: LitaaBee

customer_reviews.title: Buzzin/crackling
customer_reviews.text: Based off of the rode name I didn’t even read the reviews on this mic.... I got it in and recoded a video with it and after a very long transfer turned out my audio was ruined.... expected better from a company like rode. Although the return process was very easy it would’ve been even easier to just get a properly working microphone....
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing Noise
customer_reviews.text: Honestly you’re better off with something more expensive roughly around 300$ like the VideoMicPro+ which I bought and it’s way better in quality. Doesn’t sound terrible and doesn’t pick up any small noise that’s lower than your voice. You can hear a buzzing whenever using this mic. It’s on and off not sure why
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great for loud crowded environments.
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional musician and used this in live setting and studio settings. It is adequate but not as direction as you really need in a crowded loud environment. If you plan to do that there is not point buying this. Pay more to get the step up model that is actually a shot gun direction mic.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Rode video mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to plug into my canon for video making. I'm not thrilled with it. It still picks up white noise. Saving up to get the pro one. If you are in a pinch and need something ..this might get you by.. it wasnt what i was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Kell Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Mic wire is cheap
customer_reviews.text: The microphone is great. However the connection wire that is included is cheaply made. It allows a lot of electronic interference that it is easily distinguished in your video. Luckily it was compatible with the wire from my BOHM wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: YungSage

customer_reviews.title: Great mic works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Canon M50 for Youtube. Much better sound quality than the internal mic on the M50. While this is a directional mic, it will still pick up surrounding audio but it is noticeably muddy if the mic is not pointed at what you are recording. Easy setup and connecting, try a dead cat wind sock for outdoor filming.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Brennan

customer_reviews.title: NO WINDSHIELD, deceptive description, poor audio quality, hissing noise
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the microphone is really bad...It is slightly better than the built-in iPad microphone, but nothing special...At the beginning of each recording, it catches air/ noise. Also, the description is deceptive when they say "windshield included", this is NOT the deadcat windshield that is furry. It's just the original cover of the microphone that appears in the pictures above. DO NOT BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: MRR

customer_reviews.title: I really didn't notice a difference
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my camera for youtube videos thinking it would better the sound for my videos as my camera i was using didn't have the best microphone. It was alright, didn't notice a major difference. Get about the same audio quality as i do on my Samsung Galaxy 9.
customer_reviews.author: ACEplayTime

customer_reviews.title: Clean, Crisp Audio!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a standard across the board for vloggers and videographers. If you're serious about YouTube or making videos, you need one of these! Make sure to get the wind breaker (thing that looks like a dead rat) because it makes a huge difference outdoors and it's inexpensive. I use this with my Canon 77D and believe it is compatible with most Canon models but check just to make sure!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lomeli

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's great
customer_reviews.text: As long as it work is great well it did not work very long. After not even 2 days filming with it the mic started making weird loud noises and the audio was not usable at all. Changing the cable did not work either so i pretty much bough $70 of junk. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Angela Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good Mic, Built with cheap plastic...
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done audio wise but honestly it’s build is a piece of junk my camera simply toppled over about 3 feet to the floor and the thing broke from it’s red base........and I got it 3 days ago......this is the second one I’ve bought bc the other one broke the same way as well and you’d think for an outdoor mic or just and regular mic going for damn near 80$ that the plastic would be stronger.....honestly upsetting (new one on the left the old one of the right)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall the mic works but it does pick up a lot of ambient noise. The white noise can also be a little obsessive. When recording, I often have to lower the microphone gain on my camera so it’s not as sensitive to outside noise and white noise. For the price I can’t complain and after a few camera setting adjustments in my Sony A7iii, it works well. I like that the microphone jack is detachable and no battery’s are required.
customer_reviews.author: Justina Le

customer_reviews.title: Defective or counterfeit product. Bad noise
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this mike would work. I got lots of noise on the mic. It sounded like digital noise or crackling. I changed cameras and it was worse. I read that rode mics not fulfilled by Amazon there us a possibility of counterfeit products. I must have gotten one. It was definitely defective. Buy from a reputable dealer and stay away from this.mic.
customer_reviews.author: David Urban

customer_reviews.title: DOESN’T WORK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone to record video it and it doesn’t even work! It did at first but then it kept on working sometimes and not others. I’ve done everything I can to try and fix it but nothing happened. Ended up just selling on eBay and lost $10
customer_reviews.author: Briston

customer_reviews.title: It's a Rode Mic -- excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats a Rode mic. Did exactly what I needed it to do; windscreen is removable; plug in is long, but can be used with extender. Attaches to the top of your camera (or anything else with the attachment). If your DSLR doesn't have the attachment you'll have to rig this. Fits on the grip rig I have already reviewed. Also compatible with each of my Nikon DSLR cameras.
customer_reviews.author: MsKindleReader

customer_reviews.title: Crackles when you record. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: It crackles when I record sound with this. Can’t tell if it’s the microphone or the adaptor (also purchased from the same manufacturer). I would return but I missed the return window waiting for the adaptor so I could see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Compared to size and quality of the Micro Mic, this was 'okay.'
customer_reviews.text: Ended returning this one for the Micro one as it pretty much produced the same quality (camera: Rebel SL2) of sound for my voice and what I was using it for. Could not tell a major difference, but I know there's more 'science' behind it, but the Mirco did the job for what I need, plus it came with a dead cat and that's ALWAYS a plus!
customer_reviews.author: HOMEING

customer_reviews.title: Only one problem.
customer_reviews.text: I love rode products and would give this five stars except for one flaw. The switches to change decibel levels are hidden inside the battery compartment. The fingers of an infant are to jumbo to get to the switches, I know I tried. A pen or small device helps, but still rather difficult.
customer_reviews.author: thescvoyager

customer_reviews.title: Great at first!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to only give this 3 stars because I really enjoyed it at first. The sound quality was good and it looked nice on the camera but after about 3 weeks it went down hill. It started buzzing and adding a ticking sound over my audio which was loud enough to ruin it. I'm usually very careful with my gear but maybe it was user error. Either way it's a good mic as long as it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, But not professional
customer_reviews.text: Great solution for travel or enthusiasts, but not a solution for professional video. Audio comes out sounding very compressed. That said, its a great value for this price point and a great place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Yes, lots of yes
customer_reviews.text: I love this mic. It's small, weighs very little, and does what it's supposed to do. My only complaint is that the rear end pokes back far enough that it makes looking through the viewfinder difficult. You won't be able to press your eye to the eyecup unless you go with your left and angle your head down a bit. But since I shoot video with live view on, it's not really that big of a deal, and far from a dealbreaker. I also found this plugs into my phone and makes a wonderful pocket recording device when paired.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Still get a lot of hiss
customer_reviews.text: Could be user error but at about 3-4 feet away from mic I still get a lot of hiss that I have to fix in post with this mic. *Update* I Should have looked at the reviews prior to purchasing. I get a lot of clicking so this mic is useless. At the price points make me wonder if it's a knock-off?
customer_reviews.author: D. Booker

customer_reviews.title: I feel really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: As for material quality do not expect something fancy, it's plastic but it does the job. It's really a good first investment, I feel really happy with it an hope to use it for a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Araya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Home Movie Mic
customer_reviews.text: Just returned a broken Tascam TM-2X and bought this instead. Build quality is MUCH better with metal parts including the all important hotshoe mount! This thing is very lightweight and looks great on top of my Canon T5i for my family home videos. Sound is obviously much better quality than onboard mic but don't expect amazing professional sound out of something at this price point. It's perfect for family home videos, kid's school recitals, etc.. anything more professional than that and you'll be better off hiring a sound crew!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a "diamond in the rough", and at first I thought I had. But, there was an extremely inconsistent problem with this static electric noise. Sometimes it wasn't there, sometimes it was sporadic, and other times it was so offensively loud and persistent that it ruined the audio. If the microphone you're using has a 50/50 chance of ruining your project, it's NOT a good microphone. Go for a better microphone, a $200-$300 microphone that works well is better than a $100 mic that ends up being useless.
customer_reviews.author: AnDrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Not horrible, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Must use a gain to get ok audio. Even with a proper dead cat, this item will get wind noise from the back. Not even a clear nail polish can seal the obvious gap in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry P.

customer_reviews.title: Snap Crackle Pop noises
customer_reviews.text: This mic is apparently very very sensitive to things like bluetooth and wifi causing all kinds of digital noise and ticking. It makes it unusable with an iPhone or in any place with a wifi router without turning off all wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: Derek L

customer_reviews.title: Lots of cracking and popping noises on audio.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this mic with my Canon M6 Mark II. There was a lot of noise on the recording. It sounded like cracking and popping noise. I played around with using my own cables instead of the one included. My cables were definitely better but have no confidence in the mic. I'm going to look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well with 5D Mark iii
customer_reviews.text: This didn't have good sound quality and also didn't have the required power to work with my camcorder. It may be OK if you get for something that it is specifically made for. Check the list well.
customer_reviews.author: CBN

customer_reviews.title: ... has started recording with a ticking noise and I'm super bummed because it ruined a couple of my vlogs ...
customer_reviews.text: after two weeks it has started recording with a ticking noise and I'm super bummed because it ruined a couple of my vlogs and it's like so annoying and stuff. I tried messing with the cable. The picture shows it not tucked into the slot they have -- it's like a place for the cable to go in the back of the red thing of the mic. (The problem started when I started using that.) Reversing the direction of the cable helped for a bit but now it doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Ky Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic for my Canon T7i!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my canon T7i that I use on my YouTube channel at Cobwebs and Candlesticks. Really good sound quality over not using a Mic. I really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cobwebs and Candlesticks on YouTube

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTE TRASH. No idea why they’re charging $60+ for this. Horrible cracking and hissing. I create content for work and today’s footage is completely unusable. Multiple YouTube videos even say that this mic is useless and that the company recommends upgrading to the “pro” version which means they are comfortable with ripping people off. Such an absolute waste.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at How Positive The Other Reviews Were...not impressed
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was excited to get this. I have not been at all impressed. Have done several sound quality tests and there wasn't a significant difference between this and my 70Ds mic. The sound was a bit richer but not that great. And I'm interested to see how the flimsy construction holds up on shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely garbage been meaning to review this for months. That noise has been a headache. I have to edit audio more than footage. This mic has ruined so many videos. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: eddie perkins

customer_reviews.title: Unshielded Mic picks up all forms of EM interference & ruins your audio
customer_reviews.text: In an electromagnetic free area, this microphone is great. Put it near an electronic device and it picks up everything and trashes the audio you just recorded. I ran into the issues using both my Nikon D5600 and Sony 4K handycam. Aside form the unshielded aspect, I love the mechanical floating design. Too bad. I am in the market for another mic now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Titcombe

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy. I am a full-time videographer now after years of struggling and learning. The biggest lesson I can give is, do not buy cheap equipment! Invest!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Campos

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in perfectly or get the clicks
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is that if the cable is not 100% all the way plugged in at both ends ( and i mean 100%) it will make a clicky sound throughout the whole recording. I have to make sure everytime that i push the plugs in and do a test video to make sure. Entire videos have been ruined by the clicking. The sound quality otherwise is really good.
customer_reviews.author: michichan

customer_reviews.title: Bad buzzing noise when you're near a device emitting a signal
customer_reviews.text: The overall sound was ok. Since there is no +20 db setting on it, you can't get rid of the low humming sound from the camera. Also, when you are near devices that emit signals it has a terrible loud buzzing noise. Don't go near busy intersections, I learned that the hard way. I returned it and got the "Video Mic Pro". If you're short on cash, I would just go for the "Rode Video Micro". I don't think it's worth the $70+ dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson Kinchen

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: If you vlog or do video with a DSLR or Mirrorless camera, this mic is perfect. I bought the dead cat/wind sock separately and I've recorded everything from blogs to videos for a band with ease
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Courtemanche Jr

customer_reviews.title: Crap Sound
customer_reviews.text: I got the mic and I plugged it into my camera, and when I watched the video, there was this very loud clicking noise in the background. I kept trying different things to make it go away, but I did my research, and apparently it picks up wifi interference? Not sure if that’s true, but I’m very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for (Decent audio)
customer_reviews.text: Convient with no batteries needed. I would not recommend you use this on top of your camera as you will pick up the functioning noise of the camera. What I have done is bought an extension for the jacks and place mic on handmade boom. Works decent.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised... I used this with my GoPro 4 silver for vlogging my trip to Panama and it worked great. Audio quality had improved much more with this attached and if anyone tells you, that's one of the most important components to documenting anything. I wish there was a hard case for this, I kept the box it came with so I could pack it in my baggage. If anyone has any suggestions on how to pack this please reply.
customer_reviews.author: Randy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a sound tech so I can only speak to my use -- and for my purposes, this mic is great. I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Let's Get Reel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Please save yourself and do not buy this microphone. There is a white noise in the background that won’t go away no matter what you do. And trust me I’ve done it all. I recommend the rode videomicro which is a little cheaper than this.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mic because I was looking for something a little more affordable. This mic makes ALOT of hissing noise. I do not recommend buying this mic. If you are looking for a mic save a couple hundred more dollars and buy the ride video go mic plus. Also, do not buy off amazon because they are not an authorized dealer. Buy from guitar center or one of the companies listed on rodes website.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss standard sound quality can sound tinny. VERY Tele-cardioid
customer_reviews.text: Sound is 48kh at best, sounds a little tinny in comparison to most mics when used for live concerts. No DB level, Analog, but is way better than any build in mic, wind filter works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money for Nikon D3300 DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Authentic product. Cons: Crap build quality. Product arrived in a dirty box I think it was used. Sponge disfigured. Sounds feedback when used with Nikon D3300. Simply purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: K.Petillo

customer_reviews.title: awesome mic.
customer_reviews.text: awesome mic... use it on my DSLR and also on my galaxy s8 yo make it sound awesome. of course if you plug into phone you need the headphone/mic to 3mm adapter. I've even used this on my xbox one controller to chat and sound more clear
customer_reviews.author: Breanna S.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible audio humming noise
customer_reviews.text: Made a humming noise looked it up that is an issue with these mics do not buy if your looking for better audio. You smartphone or camera has better audio...
customer_reviews.author: christopher salih

customer_reviews.title: Good microphone for my GoPro Hero 4 Silver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my GoPro Hero 4 Silver. I had to purchase a small cable that attached my GoPro to this TRS male end of the microphone. The sound is clear and it seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: TCRay

customer_reviews.title: delivered before projected time
customer_reviews.text: The RODE Mic GO has definitely improved the sound quality of my videos coming straight out of my cameras both my DSLRs and my mirrorless cameras. The Rode Mic has worked excellent on all three of my cameras (Canon/Nikon/Sony) at this price point, I would highly recommend this microphone to anyone who is looking to boost the sound quality of there Videos or daily vlogs
customer_reviews.author: photoman605

customer_reviews.title: It's smaller than I imagined but better for storage that way
customer_reviews.text: When I got this I laughed and didn't think it would makes difference but it did and now I have the most clear audio I've hear since starwars
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

product_meta.title: Rode VideoMic GO Light Weight On-Camera Microphone
product_meta.description: Rode VideoMic go Light weight on-camera microphone.
feature_bullets: Delivers clear, crisp, directional audio with incredible ease of use
Rode designed the VideoMic GO with a tight pickup area that focuses directly in front of the mic
Reduces other surrounding sounds, ensuring that your subject is isolated from background noise
The integrated Rycote Lyre shock mount isolates the VideoMic GO from bumps and vibrations
No complicated switches or settings and is powered by your camera's external microphone input, requi

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars3,832 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
